area_name: NW End - Honeycomb and Anarchy Walls

content.description:
WINGS OF DESIRE 5.10b ** (80') F (8b)

Climb through the left side of the large lower overhang (beginning just a few feet right of Metamorphosis) to the chains at the mid-level ledge. Easier than it looks... (but also at least a letter grade harder for a shorter climber) - a really fun route.
content.protection: Fixed - 8 bolts to the chain anchors.
content.location: Climbs the left end of the large lower overhang. Beware of rattlers along the cliff in the brush at the base, seems one is always around...

content.description:
Second Skin 5.10d ** 75-170' F(7-14b)

Climbs the arete and face at the far left end of the cliff. A couple of cruxes are on the lower half. After the large ledge the route continues up the much easier (5.4) but enjoyable arete to the top. Shares top anchors with "First Light". Also possible to climb just the first half to the ring anchors at the large ledge.
content.protection: Fixed - 14 bolts, but also a few gear placements are possible on the upper face.
content.location: Far left end of the main face.

content.description:
The Purple Sage - 5.8 *** 95' F(9b)

Begin below the large pocket at the base of the right side of the wall, climb up and right and then through the upper crux at the line of smaller pockets at mid face. Lower from the pair of ring anchors. This route has mostly excellent rock and a variety of interesting moves.
content.location: MIddle of the lower right face, beginning directly below the large pocket at the base of the face.

content.description:
The Purple Rose - 5.8 ** 100' F(11b)

Begin at the right side of the lower face (just right of the overhang at the base), and climb directly up through the high crux to share the top ring anchors with The Purple Sage. Excellent sustained climbing on quality rock.
content.location: Climbs the right side of the lower face beginning just right of the overhang at the base.

content.description:
NEVERLAND 5.9 ** 95-180' F (9-17b)

Climb the face left of the large crack/chimney to the mid point anchors on the big ledge or all the way to the top - be careful of rope drag on the upper section. Also be careful, apparently there is a snake den right at the base, as well as a bunch of poison ivy. Can also be done as 2 pitches;

P1 - 5.8+ ** 95' F (9b) - Begin at the edge of the chimney and traverse left over broken rock, then climb directly up to the large ledge with the 2 chain anchors.

P2 - 5.9 ** 85' F (7b) - Continue up the face above to the high crux and 2 bolt anchors on top. Best to rappel and not lower from top chain anchors.
content.protection: fixed - 17 bolts, a couple of medium cam placements are possible but not essential between bolts. Rap anchors at the top and mid-level
content.location: Begin just left of the large chimney.

content.description:
MVP - 5.10b ** 85' M(7b)

Climbs the upper face directly above The 12th Man, beginning at the single bolt belay beside the small cave. A bouldery high steppin' start leads to a series of tricky bulging cruxes before reaching the chains on top. Medium small cam needed between bolts #1 and 2.
content.protection: Mixed, 7 bolts and a medium small cam needed between the 1st and 2nd bolts.
content.location: Climbs the upper face directly above The 12th Man at the far right end of the upper Face, beginning at the single bolt belay beside the small cave.

content.description:
Metamorphosis - 5.10c *** 90' F(11b)

Begin in the shallow right facing corner just left of the shallow overhang at the bottom of the cliff. Follow the bolts to the 2 chain anchors with an extra belay bolt. This is an excellent, sustained route that follows an aesthetic line.
content.protection: Fixed, 11 bolts. Chains at 90' with extra bolt.
content.location: 3rd route from the left (just left of the large overhang at the bottom), 2 chains at the top (just above a large ledge half way up the face).

content.description:
Mariposa 5.7 ** 85' F(7b)

Begin just left of the large hole at the base of the rusty tan wall and wind your way up to the (green) chains at the mid level ledge. Not an easy 5.7...
content.location: Climbs on the left of the lower rusty tan face (beginning left of the large lower pocket - the cocoon pod).

content.description:
LOST BOYS 5.10b/c ** 180' M(12b)

Begin 20' left of "Neverland" (at the single bolt belay), and climb up and left to avoid the initial broken and hollow rock face. Climb the right side of "the pedestal" (awkward crux mantle). Continue up past the mid-level rap ring anchors through an easier gear protected section to the bolt protected upper wall (5.9) and the 2 chain anchors on top. Can be done as 2 pitches;

P1 - 5.10 ** 95' F/M (9b)

P2 - 5.9 ** 85' M (3b)
content.protection: Mixed - 12 bolts and a wide range of cams (#00 to 2), and small nuts.
content.location: Farthest left route - begin about 30' left of the large chimney/crack at the single bolt belay.

content.description:
Live Free or Die 5.4 * 80' G

The 3rd route left from the far right of the lower face. Climb the lower corner to the low angled upper face (chain anchors on top). A wide range of cams plus a few stoppers are needed to protect.
content.protection: A wide range of cams plus a few stoppers are needed to protect.
content.location: At the far right of the lower cliff ("Anarchy Wall") three routes share the same top chain anchors. This is the left of the three, and climbs the shallow corner to the lower angled upper face.

content.description:
Indian Paintbrush - 5.10b ** 100' M(6b)

Begin at the far right edge of the middle of the lower face. Climb the arete to the large upper ledge (mostly gear protected), step left and climb the upper more difficult bolt protected face to the 2 chain anchors on the right.
content.protection: Mixed, 6 bolts and a wide range of cams.
content.location: Begin at the right end of the lower middle face,

content.description:
HONEYCOMB ROOF 5.10c*** 85' M (6b)

Begin 15' left of Honeycomb Arete directly below the large hueco and climb through the lower roof (committing 10+ crux), up the gear protected crack (5.10-), and then directly up the easier bolted face above to share the chain anchors with 'Honeycomb Arete'.
content.protection: Mixed - 6 bolts plus some small cams and nuts above the roof.
content.location: The right side of the lower overhang, beginning 15' left of Honeycomb Arete.

content.description:
Honeycomb Arete - 5.7 *** (85-165') M(3-8b)

Climbs the short lower "arete" and shallow corners at the left edge of the rusty tan lower face to the mid point rap anchors, or set of chains at the top. Can be done as one long pitch or just the excellent bottom half. This is also a good descent route for the face.

P1 - 5.7 *** (85') M(3b) - This is a fantastic mostly trad pitch on great rock, with a high bolt protected crux. Begin at the lowest point of the arete on the left edge of the rusty tan face. A wide range of cams and nuts are needed. 2 chain anchors are the mid-level belay station (with an extra belay anchor beside them).

P2 - 5.3 * (85') M(5b) From the large ledge with the rap anchors continue to the top up the upper slab which is easy but worth doing for the classic mantle move, and as an easy way to the top of the face in one pitch. 2 chain anchors and an extra bolt are at the top lip.
content.protection: Mixed, a wide range of cams (.2 to #3) and nuts are needed throughout.
content.location: Begin at the left end of the lower rusty tan face and climb directly up, angling left a bit to the slabby upper face.

content.description:
Fixin To Die - 5.5 * 80' M(3b)

Climb the face just right of the pile of loose boulders at the right end of the shorter lower face to the chain anchors on top.
content.protection: Mixed, 3 bolts, plus an assortment of small to large cams.
content.location: At the right end of the lower face just below the pile of loose looking boulders....

content.description:
First Light - 5.10a *** 90-170' F(10-17b)

Begin at the left side of the face (below the pine on top), and climb the vertical wall just left of the overhanging section at the bottom of the middle part of the face. After the mid-way chains an easy middle section leads to a slightly more challenging finish. Belay on the ledge on top by the large boulders (2 chain rap station). This is a fun and fairly sustained route on excellent rock. This is also the best/safest descent route for the whole face. Can be done as 2 pitches;

P1 - 5.10a *** 90' F(10b)

P2 - 5.6 ** 80' F(6b)
content.protection: Fixed - 17 bolts. 2 chains after 90' and 2 chains and extra bolt at the top.
content.location: Climbs the left side of the wall, 2nd route from the left beginning below the pine on top. Walk off to the north (gully), or a single rope rappel is possible from the chains half way down.

content.description:
Enemy of the State 5.4 * 80' F(6b)

The furthest route on the right, follow the line of bolts to the top, then traverse left 10' to the chain anchors. Eases off considerably after the first 40'.
content.location: The furthest route on the right.

content.description:
BEAST MODE - 5.10d ** 100' M(5b)

Begin about 10' right of the middle section of the lower face, and climb the gear protected lower face just left of the short diagonal crack (5.6). At the big ledge continue directly up and veer left onto the upper crux face. Two chain anchors with extra bolt at 100' (shared with "Indian Paintbrush"). A good route, but not as consistent as it's neighbor - easier at the start and harder at the end.

Variation link-up -

THE 12th BEAST 5.10d ** 105' F(9b)

- Climb The 12th Man and after the 5th bolt traverse up and left to join "Beast Mode" after its first bolt. Lower with care due to longer length.
content.protection: Mixed, 5 bolts and a wide variety of cams
content.location: The last route on the right side of the main face (before it turns in to a shorter cliff).

content.description:
Baby Anarchist 5.3 * 75' M(2b)

The middle route, gear protected after the first 2 bolts. Eases off considerably after the first 30', top 30' may be hard to protect.
content.protection: Mixed, 2 bolts several pieces of medium cams needed above.
content.location: Middle of the three routes on the far right.

content.description:
The 12th Man - 5.9 * 60' M(5b)

On the shorter right end of the cliff climb a direct line just left of the small brush and huge pile of loose looking boulders on the ledge above. Quality sustained climbing until the last 10', you may want a #2 camalot before the first bolt.
content.protection: Mixed, 5 bolts, a #2 camalot is needed before the first bolt. 2 bolt anchor with quick links on top (possible to get to from above without a rope).
content.location: At the shorter right end of the cliff climb just left of the bush and perched boulders on the upper ledge.

pathTokens: NW End - Honeycomb and Anarchy Walls
